channel.title: math.SG updates on arXiv.org
channel.description: math.SG updates on the arXiv.org e-print archive.

item.title: Unitalities and mapping spaces in $A_\infty$-categories
item.description: arXiv:2407.05532v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We prove, over any base ring, that the infinity-category of strictly unital A-infinity-categories (and strictly unital functors) is equivalent to the infinity-category of unital A-infinity-categories (and unital functors). We also identify various models for internal homs and mapping spaces in the infinity-categories of dg-categories and of A-infinity--categories, generalizing results of To\"en and Faonte.
item.dc:creator: Hiro Lee Tanaka

item.title: Complete Riemannian 4-manifolds with uniformly positive scalar curvature
item.description: arXiv:2407.05574v1 Announce Type: cross Abstract: We obtain topological obstructions to the existence of a complete Riemannian metric with uniformly positive scalar curvature on certain (non-compact) $4$-manifolds. In particular, such a metric on the interior of a compact contractible $4$-manifold uniquely distinguishes the standard $4$-ball up to diffeomorphism among Mazur manifolds and up to homeomorphism in general. We additionally show there exist uncountably many exotic $\mathbb{R}^4$'s that do not admit such a metric and that any (non-compact) tame $4$-manifold has a smooth structure that does not admit such a metric.
item.dc:creator: Otis Chodosh, Davi Maximo, Anubhav Mukherjee

item.title: Partial separability and symplectic-Haantjes manifolds
item.description: arXiv:2305.06844v4 Announce Type: replace-cross Abstract: A theory of partial separability for classical Hamiltonian systems is proposed in the context of Haantjes geometry. As a general result, we show that the knowledge of a non-semisimple symplectic-Haantjes manifold for a given Hamiltonian system is sufficient to construct sets of coordinates (called Darboux-Haantjes coordinates) which allow both the partial separability of the associated Hamilton-Jacobi equations and the block-diagonalization of the operators of the corresponding Haantjes algebra. We also introduce a novel class of Hamiltonian systems, characterized by the existence of a generalized St\"ackel matrix, which by construction are partially separable. They widely generalize the known families of partially separable Hamiltonian systems. Our systems can be described in terms of semisimple but non-maximal-rank symplectic-Haantjes manifolds.
item.arxiv:journal_reference: Annali di Matematica Pura e Applicata (2024), published online
item.dc:creator: Daniel Reyes, Piergiulio Tempesta, Giorgio Tondo
